alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 04 at 8:56AM MDT until April 04 at 11:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...The Southern Front Range Foothills, Fort Collins, Boulder and the western suburbs of Denver, and Castle Rock. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous, especially on bridges and overpasses. Use caution when traveling. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.
